alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Inland Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 5:38AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A BAND OF MODERATE SNOW WILL MOVE INTO WESTERN BERKELEY COUNTY AND FAR NORTHERN DORCHESTER COUNTY THROUGH DAYBREAK... A band of moderate to locally heavy snow near Elloree and Santee in Orangeburg County will move into western portions of Berkeley County and far northern Berkeley County through daybreak. Expect a burst of snow to produce a quick dusting to as much as 1/2 inch in locations such as Duncan Chapel, Harleyville, Hussertown and Cross. At 530 AM, Webcams along I-95 near Santee were already showing the ground covered with snow in grassy areas along with wet roads. Motorists along I-26 near Harleyville north to the interchange with I-95 should remain alert for reduced visibilities and slick roadways.
info.instruction: If you plan to drive or walk, remain alert for slick spots on paved surfaces. Slow your driving speed and use care when walking on sidewalks, driveways or parking lots. Slips and falls constitute a leading cause of injuries during winter weather.
